programme.title: Dievs ir lode
programme.desc: Detektīvs Bobs Haitovers atklāj, ka viņa bijusī sieva ir nogalināta un četrpadsmit gadus veco meitu nolaupījusi sātaniska sekta. Neapmierināts ar kūtro izmeklēšanu, Haitovers atkāpjas no amata un ņem lietu savās rokās. Kopā ar Keisu Hārdinu, vienīgo sievieti, kurai izdevies izbēgt no kulta nagiem, Haitovers dodas tieši ellē, lai glābtu savu meitu no maniakālā sektas līdera Sīra.

programme.title: Ielu cīņas. Leģenda par Čunu Lī
programme.desc: Pusaugu meitene Čuna Lī kļūst par aculiecinieci tēva nolaupīšanai. Pēc mātes nāves viņš ir vienīgais tuvais cilvēks, kurš pusaudzei atlicis. Pieaugusi Čuna Lī apņemas izpestīt tēvu no noziedznieku ķetnām, taču ienaidnieks ir spēcīgs. Skarbajā atriebības ceļā viņai jāstājas pretī daudziem šķēršļiem, un pamazām jaunā sieviete iemanto varones slavu.

programme.title: Kā nejauši mainīt pasauli
programme.desc: Aiz tīrās nejaušības iespējams sadarīt visu ko – pat mainīt pasauli! Sērijās apkopoti aizraujoši stāsti par nejaušiem un negaidītiem izgudrojumiem, kas mainījuši cilvēces attīstību. Kā salauzts termometrs uzvedināja zinātnieku pie idejas par pirmo fotogrāfiju? Kāda saistība plastmasai un sagrieztam pirkstam? Atklāj zinātniekus, kuriem reiz pamatīgi samisējās, un labi, ka tā!

programme.title: Āzijas ekspedīcija
programme.desc: Ginesa rekorda īpašnieks ģeogrāfs Raiens Pails dodas aizraujošā ekspedīcijā uz Āziju! Filipīnas, Ķīna, Indonēzija, Malaizija, Mongolija, Taivāna, Kirgizstāna, Taizeme, Indija, Honkonga – visas šīs zemes ir pārbagātas dabas brīnumiem, iespaidīgām metropolēm, kultūras vērtībām. Desmit mēnešus piedzīvojumu mednieks Raeins un viņa komanda pavadīja apceļojot plašo kontinentu un piedzīvojot gan iezemiešu kultūras dažādību, gan neparedzamās dabas stihijas. Pievienojies ģeogrāfu saimei – aizceļo uz kontinenta Austrumu daļu!

programme.title: Nemīlētie
programme.desc: 10. sērijaZīle atrodas Normunda dzīvoklī un iepazīstas tuvāk ar drauga mīļoto. Doļskis atgriežas nomaļajā mājā, kur pavisam nesen bija saticis Artūru Vanagu, un viņš atrod jaunus pierādījumus tam, ka Artūrs viņa izmeklētajā seifa aplaupīšanas lietā nav tikai nejaušs garāmgājējs. Par ko Normunda dzīvoklī sastrīdas Inga ar Zīli, un, kā viņš mammai paskaidros to, kāpēc viņa savu dārgo gredzenu, kurš kaut kad ir atdots lombardā, tagad atrod dēla džinsu kabatā? Artūrs sagaida policijas izmeklētāja Doļska zvanu – viņš tiek izsaukts uz nopratināšanu. Inga un Žora tiekas kafejnīcā, lai sadalītu naudu, ko ieguvuši apzogot Raimondu, tomēr notikumi pavēršas Žoram negaidītā virzienā.

programme.title: Nemīlētie
programme.desc: 11. sērijaŽora un Valts meklē no kafejnīcas aizbēgušo Ingu, bet izmeklētājs Doļskis „pieracies“ tuvāk ne vien pie pašam Artūram Vanagam, bet arī viņa draugiem un tuvajiem. To sajutis, Artūrs ļoti pārdzīvo, bet viņu kā vienmēr nomierina līgava Ieva. Žora atrodas Raimonda dzīvoklī, viņš ieradies ar Ingas paziņojumu, ka viņai neesot nekādu pretenziju, dēļ notikušās izvarošanas, ne pret uzņēmēju, ne pašu Žoru. Kamēr viņi runājas, Raimonds Žoram piedāvā papildu peļņas iespējas. Artūrs satiekas ar Zīli. Viņš draugam lūdz padomu, kā uzvesties Doļska nopratināšanā. Ko Oskars ieteiks Artūram un, vai Zīles vārdi nomierinās Normunda brāli? Normunds tikmēr svēti apsola Ingai, ka vienmēr būs ar viņu kopā, pasargās no visām briesmām un problēmām. Kamēr Žora kopā ar draugu vakariņo Raimonda dzīvoklī, atgriežas Daina. Kamēr abi pie durvīm atvadās, Daina Raimonda jakas kabatā neatrod meklēto naudu, bet gankādu dokumentu. Artūrs ierodas Doļska kabinetā, vai viņš izturēs aizdomu pilnā izmeklētāja nopratināšanu?

programme.title: Secret Nazi Science
programme.sub-title: Science was a tool to help the war effort for the Nazis; how could a Nazi soldier and its leadership be optimised, and what secret Nazi plans can we glean from a hidden crypt in Thuringia?
programme.desc: When the Nazi empire collapsed at the end of WWII, the darkest secrets of the Third Reich came to light; this series exposes everything from biological experiments to supersize feats of engineering.

programme.title: Living with Hitler
programme.sub-title: 1940-1945: early victories, then stalemate and genocide, whether watching your neighbours being packed off or being a victim. Twelve years of terror would end in devastation and division.
programme.desc: In this series we explore the realities of everyday life in Nazi Germany, how people lived, and how they then recovered from the experience of living under Nazism.

programme.title: Conquistadors: The Rise and Fall
programme.sub-title: The accidental discovery of the New World by Christopher Columbus sparked an age of exploration for the Spanish Empire - and a dark new chapter in the history of the Americas.
programme.desc: Popular culture has painted the Conquistadors as brave Christian pioneers, but a shifting narrative has revealed a darker story to their rise and fall.

programme.title: Normandy: Land of Warriors
programme.sub-title: Normandy owes its name to terrible warriors coming from the North: the Vikings. These men ravaged the Norman lands until it was ceded to them and became their territory.
programme.desc: From the Viking invasions to the great sieges of Richard the Lionheart, the history of the Dukes of Normandy is an incredible military epic spanning more than 300 years.

programme.title: Crucifixion Bones
programme.desc: In 2017, an ordinary archaeological dig in the Cambridgeshire Fens turns up a sensational discovery when the best-preserved example of a Roman crucifixion ever discovered is unearthed.

programme.title: Cities of Gold: The Reality Behind the Myth
programme.desc: Spanning from the Columbian mountains to the deserts of Peru, the discoveries made in this archaeological investigation revolutionise our perception of gold and its role over the last 500 years.

programme.title: Machu Picchu: City of Stone
programme.desc: In southern Peru stands an Inca city uninhabited for several centuries but still virtually intact: Machu Picchu. We discover the secrets behind its construction and the genius of the Inca builders.

programme.title: Forbidden History
programme.sub-title: Were they actually created by ancient people, or did they have extra-terrestrial origins? The Wests museums were taken in until it emerged that an antique dealer had them made in the 19th century.
programme.desc: This series tells incredible stories from the annals of history about great treasures, long-held conspiracy theories, ancient relics, lost civilisations and wartime secrets.

programme.title: Cursed Bloodlines
programme.sub-title: The story of how Persia morphed into Iran is very much the story of one family, the Pahlavis. Their reign would prove short-lived for a dynasty, but it was the most tumultuous in the nations history.
programme.desc: From royal families spanning centuries to billionaire business tycoons and their clans, Cursed Bloodlines examines real-life historical instances of tragically ill-fated bloodlines.

programme.title: Forbidden History
programme.sub-title: On a hill near Mt. Ararat in Turkey is what most scientists believe is just an unusually shaped rock formation; hoping to prove its the remains of Noahs Ark, a research team investigates the site.
programme.desc: This series tells incredible stories from the annals of history about great treasures, long-held conspiracy theories, ancient relics, lost civilisations and wartime secrets.

programme.title: Crucifixion Bones
programme.desc: In 2017, an ordinary archaeological dig in the Cambridgeshire Fens turns up a sensational discovery when the best-preserved example of a Roman crucifixion ever discovered is unearthed.

programme.title: Cities of Gold: The Reality Behind the Myth
programme.desc: Spanning from the Columbian mountains to the deserts of Peru, the discoveries made in this archaeological investigation revolutionise our perception of gold and its role over the last 500 years.

programme.title: Machu Picchu: City of Stone
programme.desc: In southern Peru stands an Inca city uninhabited for several centuries but still virtually intact: Machu Picchu. We discover the secrets behind its construction and the genius of the Inca builders.

programme.title: Secret Nazi Bases
programme.sub-title: North America seemed safe from the horrors of war for much of WWII, but a chilling discovery in the furthest reaches of eastern Canada hints at the true depths of the Nazis seafaring capabilities.
programme.desc: The collapse of the Third Reich left as many secrets as it did relics; remnants of the Nazis schemes still lie concealed in structures scattered across the globe today.

programme.title: Secret Nazi Bases
programme.sub-title: The Nazis did all they could behind enemy lines to keep the Luftwaffe in the air and set up shop in Kamienna Gora; do the abandoned plants and tunnels here hide Hitlers ultimate revenge weapon?
programme.desc: The collapse of the Third Reich left as many secrets as it did relics; remnants of the Nazis schemes still lie concealed in structures scattered across the globe today.

programme.title: Secret Nazi Bases
programme.sub-title: Researchers discovered a concrete city buried outside The Hague decades after WWII; more than 400 bunkers and defensive structures formed a vast underground network built to defend the coastline.
programme.desc: The collapse of the Third Reich left as many secrets as it did relics; remnants of the Nazis schemes still lie concealed in structures scattered across the globe today.

programme.title: Secret Nazi Bases
programme.sub-title: The Nazis spent the war pillaging museums, emptying coffers, and stealing everything of value; with so much still missing, where did the Nazis hide their stolen hoards?
programme.desc: The collapse of the Third Reich left as many secrets as it did relics; remnants of the Nazis schemes still lie concealed in structures scattered across the globe today.

programme.title: Secret Nazi Bases
programme.sub-title: The Nazis had all but lost the war by March of 1945, but Hitler still sent throngs of soldiers to protect an isolated area of occupied Poland from oncoming forces. What was he trying to hide?
programme.desc: The collapse of the Third Reich left as many secrets as it did relics; remnants of the Nazis schemes still lie concealed in structures scattered across the globe today.

programme.title: Top Ten Warfare
programme.sub-title: What makes a successful war leader? Influential leaders of warfare all share a vision and the ability to inspire others to follow their orders, but how they lead differs hugely.
programme.desc: This is the story of warfare in the modern age; from the Spitfire to the stealth bombers of the second Iraq conflict, each episode features ten stories from the conflicts of the 20th and 21st century.

programme.title: Top Ten Warfare
programme.sub-title: Secrecy in war can mean the difference between victory and defeat; from spies to sabotage, military commanders often turn to secret plans at the height of war in order to gain a strategic advantage.
programme.desc: This is the story of warfare in the modern age; from the Spitfire to the stealth bombers of the second Iraq conflict, each episode features ten stories from the conflicts of the 20th and 21st century.

programme.title: Top Ten Warfare
programme.sub-title: The greatest 20th-century commanders understood warfare at both strategic and tactical level; some instilled loyalty in their troops through fear and intimidation while others inspired confidence.
programme.desc: This is the story of warfare in the modern age; from the Spitfire to the stealth bombers of the second Iraq conflict, each episode features ten stories from the conflicts of the 20th and 21st century.

programme.title: Top Ten Warfare

programme.desc: This is the story of warfare in the modern age; from the Spitfire to the stealth bombers of the second Iraq conflict, each episode features ten stories from the conflicts of the 20th and 21st century.

programme.title: Top Ten Warfare
programme.sub-title: The Mark 1 tank was first used in 1916 to give the Allies an advantage in the trenches; it changed how battles were fought and became the foundation of a century of innovation in armoured vehicles.
programme.desc: This is the story of warfare in the modern age; from the Spitfire to the stealth bombers of the second Iraq conflict, each episode features ten stories from the conflicts of the 20th and 21st century.

programme.title: Mengele Unveiled
programme.sub-title: Mengele died a free man in 1979 after evading justice for over 30 years; how could this have happened, what was his life like during all those years in hiding, and who helped him?
programme.desc: Using unpublished documents, expert reports and survivor testimonies, we examine Josef Mengeles legacy and question whether he was a war criminal or solely a scapegoat for the horrors of Nazism.

programme.title: Working for the Enemy
programme.sub-title: 13 million forced labourers toil for the Nazis; it is rare that these young people experience kindness or love as the Germans are strictly prohibited from having any personal interaction with them.
programme.desc: The fate of more than 13 million Europeans was entirely overlooked in the aftermath of WWII: that of the children and young adults taken from their homes and forced to work for the enemy.
